questions.question_text: Which of the following should a penetration tester attack to gain control of the state in the HTTP protocol after the user is logged in?

A software company has hired a penetration tester to perform a penetration test on a database server. The tester has been given a variety of tools used by the company's privacy policy. Which of the following would be the BEST to use to find vulnerabilities on this server?

comments.content: Thank you for these Davar. It's appreciated

discussion.content:
Correct Answer.
Since it's a database server SQLmap would be the preferred tool.
Its the Database SERVER, so Nessus would be ideal.
How is it sqlmap when sqlmap doesn't have anything to do with database server? It's testing vulnerability of web application. It's either OpenVAS or Nessus.

questions.question_text: A penetration tester was able to gain access successfully to a Windows workstation on a mobile client's laptop. Which of the following can be used to ensure the tester is able to maintain access to the system?

choices.C: crontab ג€"l; echo ג€@reboot sleep 200 && ncat ג€"lvp 4242 ג€"e /bin/bashג€) | crontab 2>/dev/null

discussion.content:
That's wrong, it should be A.
B will just list the startup apps and their paths.

Selected Answer: A
I think this one should be A
The answer is A. The wmic caption commands TELLS you about the running or startup programs but it does not create persistence.

questions.question_text: A large client wants a penetration tester to scan for devices within its network that are Internet facing. The client is specifically looking for Cisco devices with no authentication requirements. Which of the following settings in Shodan would meet the client's requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Like has been said : "no authentication requirements" This is easily no password pointing to B.

The answer is D - "cisco-ios" "last-modified". It sounds strange but after reading this Shodan doc in the Cisco Case studies section (pages 31-35), you'll agree that the answer is without a doubt D. 

https://media.defcon.org/DEF%20CON%2018/DEF%20CON%2018%20presentations/DEF%20CON%2018%20-%20Schearer-SHODAN.pdf

Selected Answer: B
"no authentication requirements" This is easily no password pointing to B.

Selected Answer: B
This should be B

comments.content: That's true and it's a good catch, but the question asks about "no password" not "default passwords". I will go with B.

discussion.content: Cisco has admin as user cisco as a password, or cisco as a user and cisco as a password. there is no password. I would say this should be C as the default password.
I think this should be B

questions.question_text:
A tester who is performing a penetration test on a website receives the following output:
Warning: mysql_fetch_array() expects parameter 1 to be resource, boolean given in /var/www/search.php on line 62
Which of the following commands can be used to further attack the website?

discussion.content:
This looks like the website is prone to a SQL injection attack as it appears to be taking the user input directly.
I think I would choose D as it is close to a SQLi.

Answer D looks similar to SQL injection UNION attacks. 
For example:
SELECT a, b FROM table1 UNION SELECT c, d FROM table2

Ref: 
https://portswigger.net/web-security/sql-injection/union-attacks
